topic.title: Creating a database cluster from Horizon

body.p: This document describes how to create a database cluster from the Horizon interface.

ol.li: Log into the Horizon web interface. Select Project, Database, Clusters. Click Launch Cluster.

In the Launch Cluster page, enter the following information and click Launch Cluster:
Cluster Name: The name of the cluster to be created. The cluster ID will be generated automatically.
Datastore: The database type to be used. MySql, Redis and MongoDB are supported.
Flavor: The instance flavor (virtual hardware template) to use for the cluster.
Network: The OpenStack network to attach to the cluster.
Volume Size: The size in GB of the new cluster. MongoDB instances require a minimum volume size of 5.
Number of Shards (MongoDB only): The number of MongoDB shards to span the database across. One shard will be used to create the database cluster; this value cannot be changed. See Sharding for more information.
Number of Instances: The number of OpenStack instances to span the database across. Three instances will be used to create the cluster; this value cannot be changed, but more instances can be added later.
The number of instances and shards is not editable.

The new cluster will be created, and appear in the Clusters page. Once it is done creating, the status will display as None, indicating that the cluster is finished provisioning. Click on the name of the cluster to see details of the cluster and the status of the cluster.
